description:
Comet Neowise during its close approach to Earth.

You'll notice two tails. The blue one is the ion tail, caused by the sun's radiation electrically charging the gases. The larger more diffuse tail is the dust tail, where particles are released as the sun vaporizes the comet.

Equipment:
OTA: William Optics GT81 w/0.8x reducer (382mm fl at f/4.7)
74mm aperture stop-down ring (brings scope to f/5.2)
Mount: Orion Sirius EQ-G (HEQ-5)
Guidescope: Orion 50mm guidescope
Guiding camera: Orion StarShoot Autoguider
Imaging camera: ZWO ASI1600MM-Cool 

Accessories:
QHYCCD PoleMaster

Software:
SGP
PHD2
CdC
PixInsight

Acquisition:
Location:
Ft. Griffin State Historic Site, TX
Date: 7/19/2020 (from 10:17-11:09pm)
Gain: 76 Offset: 15
Camera temp: -10C
R: 13x60"
G: 11x60"
B: 12x60"
Total integration time: 36min
64x darks per calibration
30x flats per calibration
200x bias per calibration

Preprocessing:
BatchPreProcessing to calibrate lights
StarAlignment to register lights

To create image for stars:
ImageIntegration on star aligned lights

To create comet-only image:
CometAlignment on star aligned lights
Used ProcessContainer and ImageContainer in conjunction with PixelMath and StarNet to stretch, run StarNet, and finally invert stretch to return to linear. 
ImageIntegration of comet aligned starless lights.

Processing on star aligned masters:
DynamicCrop
DynamicBackgroundExtraction
ChannelCombination
BackgroundNeutralization
ColorCalibration
SCNR Green
ArcsinhStretch x2
HistogramTransformation
SCNR Green (making sure there are no green stars on this master)

Processing comet-only masters:
DynamicCrop
TGVDenoise
ChannelCombination
DynamicBackgroundExtraction
BackgroundNeutralization
SCNR Green on background sky
HistogramTransformation
LocalHistogramEqualization
CurvesTransformation
SCNR Green on low signal areas
TGVDenoise targeting background chrominance
LarsonSekanina for contrast enhancements centered on the nucleus
ColorSaturation
CurvesTransformation

Added in stars from the star aligned master using a star mask and PixelMath

MorphologicalTransformation to slightly reduce stars
CurvesTransformation to saturate stars
UnsharpMask to slightly sharpen stars
NoiseGenerator to bring back some fine grain noise to the image.
Resampled 50% for web posting
title: Comet C/2020 F3 (NEOWISE)
